title: What Are the Guidelines for the Responsible Use of Drugs for Spiritual Purposes?
first_phrase: In the previous part of the text, Evola explains how the establishment of a priestly caste against sacred regality marked the beginning of a decline in some ancient civilizations. In the last 200 tokens, he supports the thesis that the primacy of a warrior or regal tradition over a clergy or priesthood, as well as the primacy of action over knowledge, does not necessarily lead to a decline in civilization. He argues that the loss of contact with metaphysical reality is a more significant cause of decadence. Finally, he touches on the topic of drugs, which was mentioned in a previous volume.

last_phrase: In conclusion, the loss of contact with the metaphysical reality is the source of the Western world's decadence. In order to react effectively, we need to re-establish this connection. Moreover, for those seeking to use drugs for higher purposes, it is essential to consider the personal toxic equation and acknowledge the fundamental difference between their approach and the widespread profane use of drugs that leads only to degradation and self-destruction.
